edX Support

For questions on course lectures, homework, tools, or materials for this course, post in the course discussion forum.

Have general questions about edX? You can find lots of helpful information in the edX FAQ.

Have a question about something specific? You can contact the edX general support team directly:



Please note: The edX support team is English speaking. While we will do our best to address your inquiry in any language, our responses will be in English.

Describe what you were doing when you encountered the issue. Include any details that will help us to troubleshoot, including error messages that you saw.

Thank You!

Thank you for your inquiry or feedback. We typically respond to a request within one business day, Monday to Friday. In the meantime, please review our detailed FAQs where most questions have already been answered.

Course Unit 2: Linear Regression Assignment 2 Climate Change
<div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-vertical" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="VerticalStudentView" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@8afd96a609a1464dac8e3646833b2ee5" data-block-type="vertical"> <h2 class="hd hd-2 unit-title">Climate Change</h2> <div class="bookmark-button-wrapper"> <button class="btn btn-link bookmark-button " aria-pressed="false" data-bookmark-id="strgeon,block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@8afd96a609a1464dac8e3646833b2ee5" data-bookmarks-api-url="/api/bookmarks/v1/bookmarks/"> <span class="bookmark-text">Bookmark this page</span> </button> </div> <div class="vert-mod"> <div class="vert vert-0" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@68a102b0aa6c40a181bde4a8c74e8a2d"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-html xmodule_display xmodule_HtmlModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="html" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@68a102b0aa6c40a181bde4a8c74e8a2d" data-type="HTMLModule" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "HTMLModule"} </script> <h2>Climate Change</h2> <p>There have been many studies documenting that the average global temperature has been increasing over the last century. The consequences of a continued rise in global temperature will be dire. Rising sea levels and an increased frequency of extreme weather events will affect billions of people.</p> <p>In this problem, we will attempt to study the relationship between average global temperature and several other factors.</p> <p>The file <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="//d37djvu3ytnwxt.cloudfront.net/assets/courseware/v1/f43727842620758fda4e204cc0d7d558/asset-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@asset+block/climate_change.csv">climate_change.csv</a></span> contains climate data from May 1983 to December 2008. The available variables include:</p> <ul> <li><em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">Year</em>: the observation year.</li> <li><em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">Month</em>: the observation month.</li> <li><em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">Temp</em>: the difference in degrees Celsius between the average global temperature in that period and a reference value. This data comes from the <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="http://www.cru.uea.ac.uk/cru/data/temperature/">Climatic Research Unit at the University of East Anglia</a></span>.</li> <li><em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">CO2</em>,&nbsp;<em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">N2O</em>, <em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">CH4</em>,&nbsp;<em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">CFC.11</em>, <em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">CFC.12</em>: atmospheric concentrations of carbon dioxide (CO<sub style="line-height: 1.6em;">2</sub>), nitrous oxide (N<sub style="line-height: 1.6em;">2</sub>O), methane&nbsp; (CH<sub style="line-height: 1.6em;">4</sub>), trichlorofluoromethane (CCl<sub style="line-height: 1.6em;">3</sub>F; commonly referred to as CFC-11) and dichlorodifluoromethane (CCl<sub style="line-height: 1.6em;">2</sub>F<sub style="line-height: 1.6em;">2</sub>; commonly referred to as CFC-12), respectively. This data comes from the <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="http://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/data-products.html">ESRL/NOAA Global Monitoring Division</a></span>.</li> <ul> <li>CO2, N2O and CH4 are expressed in ppmv (parts per million by volume&nbsp; -- i.e., 397 ppmv of CO2 means that CO2 constitutes 397 millionths of the total volume of the atmosphere)</li> <li>CFC.11 and CFC.12 are expressed in ppbv (parts per billion by volume).&nbsp;</li> </ul> <li><em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">Aerosols</em>: the mean stratospheric aerosol optical depth at 550 nm. This variable is linked to volcanoes, as volcanic eruptions result in new particles being added to the atmosphere, which affect how much of the sun's energy is reflected back into space. This data is from the <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="http://data.giss.nasa.gov/modelforce/strataer/">Godard Institute for Space Studies at NASA</a></span>.</li> <li><em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">TSI</em>: the total solar irradiance (TSI) in W/m<sup style="line-height: 1.6em;">2</sup> (the rate at which the sun's energy is deposited per unit area). Due to sunspots and other solar phenomena, the amount of energy that is given off by the sun varies substantially with time. This data is from the <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="http://solarisheppa.geomar.de/solarisheppa/cmip5">SOLARIS-HEPPA project website</a></span>.<span style="color: #222222; font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 13.63636302947998px; line-height: normal;"><br /></span></li> <li><em style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">MEI</em>: multivariate El Nino Southern Oscillation index (MEI), a measure of the strength of the <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_nino" target="_blank">El Nino/La Nina-Southern Oscillation</a></span> (a weather effect in the Pacific Ocean that affects global temperatures).&nbsp;This data comes from the <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="http://www.esrl.noaa.gov/psd/enso/mei/table.html">ESRL/NOAA Physical Sciences Division</a></span>.</li> </ul> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-1" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0.0" data-problem-total-possible="2.0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 1.1 - Creating Our First Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;We are interested in how changes in these variables affect future temperatures, as well as how well these variables explain temperature changes so far. To do this, first read the dataset climate_change.csv into R.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Then, split the data into a &lt;em&gt;training set&lt;/em&gt;, consisting of all the observations up to and including 2006, and a &lt;em&gt; testing set&lt;/em&gt; consisting of the remaining years (hint: use subset). A training set refers to the data that will be used to build the model (this is the data we give to the lm() function), and a testing set refers to the data we will use to test our predictive ability. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Next, build a linear regression model to predict the dependent variable Temp, using MEI, CO2, CH4, N2O, CFC.11, CFC.12, TSI, and Aerosols as independent variables (&lt;em&gt;Year&lt;/em&gt; and &lt;em&gt;Month&lt;/em&gt; should NOT be used in the model). Use the training set to build the model.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Enter the model R&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt; (the &#34;Multiple R-squared&#34; value):&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_4b2aa5cd72a848d9b2abae94f03cb274_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-2" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="1" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 1.2 - Creating Our First Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which variables are significant in the model? We will consider a variable signficant only if the p-value is below 0.05. (Select all that apply.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; MEI &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; CO2 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; CH4 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; N2O &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1-choice_4-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1_choice_4&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_4&#34;/&gt; CFC.11 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1-choice_5-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1_choice_5&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_5&#34;/&gt; CFC.12 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1-choice_6-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1_choice_6&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_6&#34;/&gt; TSI &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1-choice_7-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1_choice_7&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_7&#34;/&gt; Aerosols &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_73ebad2ddf9441ba93a3d6ddbe783cff_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 2.1 - Understanding the Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Current scientific opinion is that nitrous oxide and CFC-11 are greenhouse gases: gases that are able to trap heat from the sun and contribute to the heating of the Earth. However, the regression coefficients of both the N2O and CFC-11 variables are &lt;strong&gt;negative&lt;/strong&gt;, indicating that increasing atmospheric concentrations of either of these two compounds is associated with lower global temperatures.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which of the following is the &lt;em&gt;simplest&lt;/em&gt; correct explanation for this contradiction?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; Climate scientists are wrong that N2O and CFC-11 are greenhouse gases - this regression analysis constitutes part of a disproof. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; There is not enough data, so the regression coefficients being estimated are not accurate. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; All of the gas concentration variables reflect human development - N2O and CFC.11 are correlated with other variables in the data set. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 2.1 - Understanding the Model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 1 attempt &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;85755452124b4d8aa79f85164f0f64bc-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-4" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="2" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 2.2 - Understanding the Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Compute the correlations between all the variables in the training set. Which of the following independent variables is N2O highly correlated with (absolute correlation greater than 0.7)? Select all that apply.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1[]&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; CO2 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; CH4 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; CFC.11 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1-choice_4-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1_choice_4&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_4&#34;/&gt; CFC.12 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1-choice_5-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1_choice_5&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_5&#34;/&gt; Aerosols &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1-choice_6-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which of the following independent variables is CFC.11 highly correlated with? Select all that apply.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_3_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_7a99b59975fb44f4b9d14162fef3cd18_3_1[]&#34; Problem 3 - Simplifying the Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Given that the correlations are so high, let us focus on the N2O variable and build a model with only MEI, TSI, Aerosols and N2O as independent variables. Remember to use the training set to build the model.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Enter the coefficient of N2O in this reduced model:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;(How does this compare to the coefficient in the previous model with all of the variables?)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Enter the model R&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_3_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_3_1&#34; id=&#34;input_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_3_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_3_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_3_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_3_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_3_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3 - Simplifying the Model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 5 attempts &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;407d5980c2544a6b9709563675d7b625-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-6" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0.0" data-problem-total-possible="4.0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 4 - Automatically Building the Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;We have many variables in this problem, and as we have seen above, dropping some from the model does not decrease model quality. R provides a function, &lt;u&gt;&lt;a href=&#34;http://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/stats/html/step.html&#34;&gt;step&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/u&gt;, that will automate the procedure of trying different combinations of variables to find a good compromise of model simplicity and R&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;. This trade-off is formalized by the &lt;u&gt;&lt;a href=&#34;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akaike_information_criterion&#34;&gt;Akaike information criterion&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/u&gt; (AIC) - it can be informally thought of as the quality of the model with a penalty for the number of variables in the model.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The step function has one argument - the name of the initial model. It returns a simplified model. Use the step function in R to derive a new model, with the full model as the initial model (HINT: If your initial full model was called &#34;climateLM&#34;, you could create a new model with the step function by typing step(climateLM). Be sure to save your new model to a variable name so that you can look at the summary. For more information about the step function, type ?step in your R console.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Enter the R&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt; value of the model produced by the step function:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which of the following variable(s) were eliminated from the full model by the step function? Select all that apply.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; MEI &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; CO2 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; CH4 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; N2O &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1-choice_4-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1_choice_4&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_4&#34;/&gt; CFC.11 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1-choice_5-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1_choice_5&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_5&#34;/&gt; CFC.12 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1-choice_6-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1_choice_6&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_6&#34;/&gt; TSI &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1-choice_7-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1_choice_7&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_7&#34;/&gt; Aerosols &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_3_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;It is interesting to note that the step function does not address the collinearity of the variables, except that adding highly correlated variables will not improve the R&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt; significantly. The consequence of this is that the step function will not necessarily produce a very interpretable model - just a model that has balanced quality and simplicity for a particular weighting of quality and simplicity (AIC).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 4 - Automatically Building the Model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 4 attempts &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;901a278a0eaf4fca9e8bc724d1790f5c-problem-title&#34;&gt; id=&#34;593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 5 - Testing on Unseen Data &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;We have developed an understanding of how well we can fit a linear regression to the training data, but does the model quality hold when applied to unseen data?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Using the model produced from the step function, calculate temperature predictions for the testing data set, using the predict function.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Enter the testing set R&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;/sup&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_593a4ab62427478eaa4ae4cc430d881d_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-show-template"> <div class="discussion-post"> <header class="post-header"> <% if (!readOnly) { %> <div class="post-header-actions"> <%= _.template( $('#forum-actions').html())( { contentId: cid, contentType: 'post', primaryActions: ['vote', 'follow'], secondaryActions: ['pin', 'edit', 'delete', 'report', 'close'], readOnly: readOnly } ) %> </div> <% } %> <div class="post-header-content"> <h<%- startHeader %> class="post-title"><%- title %></h<%- startHeader%>> <p class="posted-details"> <% var timeAgoHtml = interpolate( '<span class="timeago" title="%(created_at)s">%(created_at)s</span>', {created_at: created_at}, true ); var postedTimeAgoMessage; // Using a separate message to ensure proper translation for different languages // thread_type describes the kind of post this is (e.g. "question" or "discussion"); // time_ago is how much time has passed since the post was created (e.g. "4 hours ago") if (thread_type === 'discussion') { postedTimeAgoMessage = gettext('discussion posted %(time_ago)s by %(author)s'); } else { postedTimeAgoMessage = gettext('question posted %(time_ago)s by %(author)s'); } %> <%= interpolate(_.escape(postedTimeAgoMessage), {time_ago: timeAgoHtml, author: author_display}, true) %> </p> <div class="post-labels"> <span class="post-label post-label-pinned"> <span class="icon fa fa-thumb-tack" aria-hidden="true"></span><%- gettext("Pinned") %> </span> <span class="post-label post-label-reported"> <span class="icon fa fa-flag" aria-hidden="true"></span><%- gettext("Reported") %> </span> <span class="post-label post-label-closed"> <span class="icon fa fa-lock" aria-hidden="true"></span><%- gettext("Closed") %> </span> </div> </div> </header> <div class="post-body"><%- body %></div> <div class="post-context"> <% if (mode === "tab" && obj.courseware_url) { %> <% var courseware_title_linked = interpolate( '<a href="%(courseware_url)s">%(courseware_title)s</a>', {courseware_url: courseware_url, courseware_title: _.escape(courseware_title)}, true ); %> <%= interpolate( _.escape(gettext('Related to: %(courseware_title_linked)s')), {courseware_title_linked: courseware_title_linked}, true ) %> <% } %> <div class="group-visibility-label"> <% if (obj.group_name && is_commentable_divided) { %> <%- interpolate( gettext('This post is visible only to %(group_name)s.'), {group_name: obj.group_name}, true ) %> <% } else { %> <%- gettext('This post is visible to everyone.') %> <% } %> </div> </div> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-edit-template"> <h<%- startHeader%> class="thread-title"><%- gettext("Editing post") %></h<%- startHeader%>> <ul class="post-errors"></ul> <div class="forum-edit-post-form-wrapper"></div> <div class="post-field"> <label class="field-label"> <span class="field-label-text"><%- gettext("Title") %></span> <div class="field-help" id="field_help_title"> <%- gettext("Add a clear and descriptive title to encourage participation. (Required)") %> </div> <input aria-describedby="field_help_title" type="text" class="edit-post-title field-input" name="title" value="<%- title %>"> </label> </div> <div class="form-row post-field"> <p class="sr-only field-help" id="edit-post-editor-description"><%- gettext('Edit your post below.') %></p> <div class="edit-post-body" aria-describedby="edit-post-editor-description" name="body"><%- body %></div> </div> <button type="submit" id="edit-post-submit" class="btn-brand submit post-update"><%- gettext("Update post") %></button> <button class="btn post-cancel"><%- gettext("Cancel") %></button> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-response-template"> <div class="discussion-response"></div> <button class="btn-link action-show-comments"> <% var fmts = ngettext("Show Comment (%(num_comments)s)", "Show Comments (%(num_comments)s)", comments.length); print(interpolate(fmts, {num_comments: comments.length}, true)); %> <span class="icon fa fa-caret-down" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> <ol class="comments"> <li class="new-comment"> <% if (create_sub_comment && !readOnly) { %> <form class="comment-form" data-id="<%- wmdId %>"> <ul class="discussion-errors"></ul> <label class="sr" for="add-new-comment-<%- wmdId %>"><%- gettext("Add a comment") %></label> <div class="comment-body" id="add-new-comment-<%- wmdId %>" data-id="<%- wmdId %>" data-placeholder="<%- gettext('Add a comment') %>"></div> <div class="comment-post-control"> <button class="btn-brand discussion-submit-comment control-button"><%- gettext("Submit") %></button> </div> </form> <% } %> </li> </ol> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-response-show-template"> <header class="response-header"> <div class="response-header-content"> <%= author_display %> <p class="posted-details"> <span class="timeago" title="<%= created_at %>"><%= created_at %></span> <% if (obj.endorsement && obj.endorsed) { %> - <% var fmt = null; if (thread.get("thread_type") == "question") { if (endorsement.username) { // Translators: time_ago is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp // like "4 hours ago" or "about a month ago" fmt = gettext("marked as answer %(time_ago)s by %(user)s"); } else { // Translators: time_ago is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp // like "4 hours ago" or "about a month ago" fmt = gettext("marked as answer %(time_ago)s"); } } else { if (endorsement.username) { // Translators: time_ago is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp // like "4 hours ago" or "about a month ago" fmt = gettext("endorsed %(time_ago)s by %(user)s"); } else { // Translators: time_ago is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp // like "4 hours ago" or "about a month ago" fmt = gettext("endorsed %(time_ago)s"); } } var time_ago = interpolate( '<span class="timeago" title="%(time)s">%(time)s</span>', {time: endorsement.time}, true ); %> <%= interpolate(fmt, {time_ago: time_ago, user: endorser_display}, true) %> <% } %> </p> <div class="post-labels"> <span class="post-label post-label-reported"> <span class="icon fa fa-flag" aria-hidden="true"></span><%- gettext("Reported") %> </span> </div> </div> <div class="response-header-actions"> <%= _.template( $('#forum-actions').html())( { contentId: cid, contentType: 'response', primaryActions: ['vote', thread.get('thread_type') == 'question' ? 'answer' : 'endorse'], secondaryActions: ['edit', 'delete', 'report'], readOnly: readOnly } ) %> </div> </header> <div class="response-body"><%- body %></div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-response-edit-template"> <div class="edit-post-form"> <h<%- startHeader %>><%- gettext("Editing response") %></h<%- startHeader %>> <ul class="edit-post-form-errors"></ul> <div class="form-row"> <div class="edit-post-body" name="body" data-id="<%- id %>"><%- body %></div> </div> <button type="submit" id="edit-response-submit"class="btn-brand post-update"><%- gettext("Update response") %></button> <button class="btn post-cancel"><%- gettext("Cancel") %></button> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="response-comment-show-template"> <div class="discussion-comment" id="comment_<%- id %>"> <div class="response-body"><%- body %></div> <%= _.template( $('#forum-actions').html())( { contentId: cid, contentType: 'comment', primaryActions: [], secondaryActions: ['edit', 'delete', 'report'], readOnly: readOnly } ) %> <p class="posted-details"> <% var time_ago = interpolate( '<span class="timeago" title="%(time)s">%(time)s</span>', {time: created_at}, true ); %> <%= interpolate( // Translators: 'timeago' is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp (see: https://github.com/rmm5t/jquery-timeago) gettext("posted %(time_ago)s by %(author)s"), {time_ago: time_ago, author: author_display}, true ) %> </p> <div class="post-labels"> <span class="post-label post-label-reported"> <span class="icon fa fa-flag" aria-hidden="true"></span><%- gettext("Reported") %> </span> </div> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="response-comment-edit-template"> <div class="edit-post-form" id="comment_<%- id %>"> <h<%- startHeader %> ><%- gettext("Editing comment") %></h<%- startHeader%>> <ul class="edit-comment-form-errors"></ul> <div class="form-row"> <div class="edit-comment-body" name="body" data-id="<%- id %>"><%- body %></div> </div> <button type="submit" id="edit-comment-submit" class="btn-brand post-update"><%- gettext("Update comment") %></button> <button class="btn post-cancel"><%- gettext("Cancel") %></button> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-list-item-template"> <li data-id="<%- id %>" class="forum-nav-thread<% if (!hideReadState && neverRead) { %> never-read<% } %>"> <a href="<%- threadUrl %>" class="forum-nav-thread-link"> <div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-0"> <% var icon_class, sr_text; if (thread_type === "discussion") { icon_class = "fa-comments"; // Translators: This is a label for a Discussion forum thread sr_text = gettext("discussion"); } else if (endorsed) { icon_class = "fa-check-square-o"; // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread with a marked answer sr_text = gettext("answered question"); } else { icon_class = "fa-question"; // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread without a marked answer sr_text = gettext("unanswered question"); } %> <span class="sr"><%= sr_text %></span> <span class="icon fa <%= icon_class %>" aria-hidden="true"></span> </div><div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-1"> <span class="forum-nav-thread-title"><%- title %></span> <% if (showThreadPreview){ %> <div class="thread-preview-body"><%- threadPreview %></div> <% } %> <% if(typeof(subscribed) === "undefined") { var subscribed = null; } %> <% if(pinned || subscribed || staff_authored || community_ta_authored) { %> <ul class="forum-nav-thread-labels"> <% if (pinned) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-pinned"> <span class="icon fa fa-thumb-tack" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that has been pinned %> <%- gettext("Pinned") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (subscribed) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-following"> <span class="icon fa fa-star" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that the user is subscribed to %> <%- gettext("Following") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (staff_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-staff"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a member of the course staff %> <%- gettext("Staff") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (community_ta_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-community-ta"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a community TA %> <%- gettext("Community TA") %> </li> <% } %> </ul> <% } %> </div><div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-2"> <% // Translators: 'votes_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_start' and 'span_end' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'votes'. var fmt = ngettext( "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s vote %(span_end)s", "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s votes %(span_end)s", votes['up_count'] ); %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-votes-count"> +<%= interpolate(fmt, { votes_count: votes['up_count'], span_start: '<span class="sr">', span_end: '</span>' }, true) %> </span> <% if (!hideReadState && !neverRead && unread_comments_count > 0) { %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-unread-comments-count"> <%- StringUtils.interpolate( gettext('{unread_comments_count} new'), {unread_comments_count: unread_comments_count} ) %> </span> <% } %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-comments-count"> <% var fmt; // Counts in data do not include the post itself, but the UI should var data = { 'span_sr_open': '<span class="sr">', 'span_close': '</span>', 'unread_comments_count': unread_comments_count + (read ? 0 : 1), 'comments_count': comments_count + 1 }; if (unread_comments_count > 0) { // Translators: 'comments_count' and 'unread_comments_count' are numerical placeholders for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments (%(unread_comments_count)s unread comments)%(span_close)s'); } else { // Translators: 'comments_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments %(span_close)s'); } print(interpolate(fmt, data, true)); %> </span> </div> </a> </li> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="search-alert-template"> <div class="search-alert <%- css_class %>" id="search-alert-<%- cid %>"> <div class="search-alert-content"> <p class="message"><%= HtmlUtils.ensureHtml(messageHtml) %></p> </div> <div class="search-alert-controls"> <button class="btn-link dismiss control control-dismiss" title="<%- gettext('Close') %>"> <span class="icon fa fa-remove" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> </div> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="new-post-template"> <form class="forum-new-post-form"> <h<%- startHeader %> class="thread-title"><%- gettext("Add a Post") %></h<%- startHeader %>> <% if (mode === 'inline') { %> <button class="btn-default add-post-cancel"> <span class="sr"><%- gettext('Cancel') %></span> <span class="fa fa-close" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> <% } %> <ul class="post-errors" style="display: none"></ul> <div class="forum-new-post-form-wrapper"></div> <% if (group_options) { %> <div class="post-field group-selector-wrapper <% if (!is_commentable_divided) { print('disabled'); class="inline-thread"> <div class="forum-nav-bar"> <button class="btn-link all-posts-btn"> <span class="icon fa fa-chevron-prev" aria-hidden="true"></span> <span aria-hidden="true"><%- gettext('All <div class="discussion-post"> <header> <h3><%- title %></h3> <p class="posted-details"> <% if (user) { %> <a href="<%- user.url %>" class="username"><%- user.username %></a> <% } else { %> <%- data-user-create-comment="true" data-user-create-subcomment="true" data-read-only="false"> <div class="discussion-module-header"> <h3 class="hd hd-3 discussion-module-title">Discussion</h3> <div class="inline-discussion-topic"><span class="inline-discussion-topic-title">Topic:</span> Unit 2 / Unit 2, Homework: Climate Change </div> </div> <button class="discussion-show btn" data-discussion-id="91a3d9427ed14a94b9a7ae5dc092d527"> <span class="button-text">Show Discussion</span> </button> </div> <script type="text/javascript"> var $$course_id = "course\u002Dv1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"; function DiscussionInlineBlock(runtime, element) { 'use strict'; var el = $(element).find('.discussion-module'); new DiscussionInlineView({ el: el, readOnly: <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-vertical" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="VerticalStudentView" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@4b3b83d587094667add09d9535f0a798" data-block-type="vertical"> <h2 class="hd hd-2 unit-title">Reading Test Scores</h2> <div class="bookmark-button-wrapper"> <button class="btn btn-link bookmark-button " aria-pressed="false" data-bookmark-id="strgeon,block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@4b3b83d587094667add09d9535f0a798" data-bookmarks-api-url="/api/bookmarks/v1/bookmarks/"> <span class="bookmark-text">Bookmark this page</span> </button> </div> <div class="vert-mod"> <div class="vert vert-0" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@576717d6193841a49744852aaca84866"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-html xmodule_display xmodule_HtmlModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="html" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@576717d6193841a49744852aaca84866" data-type="HTMLModule" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "HTMLModule"} </script> <h2>Reading Test Scores</h2> <p>The Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA) is a test given every three years to 15-year-old students from around the world to evaluate their performance in mathematics, reading, and science. This test provides a quantitative way to compare the performance of students from different parts of the world. In this homework assignment, we will predict the reading scores of students from the United States of America on the 2009 PISA exam.</p> <p>The datasets <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="//d37djvu3ytnwxt.cloudfront.net/assets/courseware/v1/d2c0eaf1a7b1aeee047a2be54e0c6173/asset-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@asset+block/pisa2009train.csv">pisa2009train.csv</a></span> and <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="//d37djvu3ytnwxt.cloudfront.net/assets/courseware/v1/b1cf56f09e79ee9b71b38143560252be/asset-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@asset+block/pisa2009test.csv">pisa2009test.csv</a></span> contain information about the demographics and schools for American students taking the exam, derived from <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="http://nces.ed.gov/pubsearch/pubsinfo.asp?pubid=2011038">2009 PISA Public-Use Data Files</a></span> distributed by the United States National Center for Education Statistics (NCES). While the datasets are not supposed to contain identifying information about students taking the test, by using the data you are bound by the <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="//d37djvu3ytnwxt.cloudfront.net/assets/courseware/v1/8522b75c7463c923fb96ae274fdf8213/asset-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@asset+block/NCES_Data_Use_Agreement.txt">NCES data use agreement</a></span>, which prohibits any attempt to determine the identity of any student in the datasets.</p> <p>Each row in the datasets pisa2009train.csv and pisa2009test.csv represents one student taking the exam. The datasets have the following variables:</p> <p><strong>grade: </strong>The grade in school of the student (most 15-year-olds in America are in 10th grade)</p> <p><strong>male:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student is male (1/0)</p> <p><strong style="font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.6em;">raceeth:&nbsp;</strong>The race/ethnicity composite of the student</p> <p><strong>preschool:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student attended preschool (1/0)</p> <p><strong>expectBachelors:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student expects to obtain a bachelor's degree (1/0)</p> <p><b>motherHS:&nbsp;</b>Whether the student's mother completed high school (1/0)</p> <p><strong>motherBachelors:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student's mother obtained a bachelor's degree (1/0)</p> <p><strong>motherWork:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student's mother has part-time or full-time work (1/0)</p> <p><strong>fatherHS:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student's father completed high school (1/0)</p> <p><strong>fatherBachelors:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student's father obtained a bachelor's degree (1/0)</p> <p><strong>fatherWork:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student's father has part-time or full-time work (1/0)</p> <p><strong>selfBornUS:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student was born in the United States of America (1/0)</p> <p><strong>motherBornUS:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student's mother was born in the United States of America (1/0)</p> <p><strong>fatherBornUS:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student's father was born in the United States of America (1/0)</p> <p><strong>englishAtHome:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student speaks English at home (1/0)</p> <p><strong>computerForSchoolwork:&nbsp;</strong>Whether the student has access to a computer for schoolwork (1/0)</p> <p><b>read30MinsADay:&nbsp;</b>Whether the student reads for pleasure for 30 minutes/day (1/0)</p> <p><strong>minutesPerWeekEnglish:&nbsp;</strong>The number of minutes per week the student spend in English class</p> <p><strong>studentsInEnglish:&nbsp;</strong>The number of students in this student's English class at school</p> <p><strong>schoolHasLibrary:&nbsp;</strong>Whether this student's school has a library (1/0)</p> <p><strong>publicSchool:&nbsp;</strong>Whether this student attends a public school (1/0)</p> <p><strong>urban:&nbsp;</strong>Whether this student's school is in an urban area (1/0)</p> <p><strong>schoolSize:</strong> The number of students in this student's school</p> <p><strong>readingScore:&nbsp;</strong>The student's reading score, on a 1000-point scale</p> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-1" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="1" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff-problem-title&#34; class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Load the training and testing sets using the read.csv() function, and save them as variables with the names pisaTrain and pisaTest.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;How many students are there in the training set?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input aria-describedby=&#34;c1b9c2df9a064faca6ddb1981ee628ff-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; id=&#34;0a47ed24b151443b8f941b02a0bfd4df-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@0a47ed24b151443b8f941b02a0bfd4df-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 1.2 - Summarizing the dataset &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@0a47ed24b151443b8f941b02a0bfd4df-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Using tapply() on pisaTrain, what is the average reading test score of males?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_0a47ed24b151443b8f941b02a0bfd4df_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_0a47ed24b151443b8f941b02a0bfd4df_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_0a47ed24b151443b8f941b02a0bfd4df_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_0a47ed24b151443b8f941b02a0bfd4df_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which variables are missing data in at least one observation in the training set? Problem 1.4 - Removing missing values &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Linear regression discards observations with missing data, so we will remove all such observations from the training and testing sets. Later in the course, we will learn about imputation, which deals with missing data by filling in missing values with plausible information.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Type the following commands into your R console to remove observations with any missing value from pisaTrain and pisaTest:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;pisaTrain = na.omit(pisaTrain)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;pisaTest = na.omit(pisaTest)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;How many observations are now in the training set?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;How many observations are now in the testing set?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_3_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_3_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_8e4635c626574cf5b68acc9911e6c07c_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
