id=&#34;720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 2.1 - Factor variables &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Factor variables are variables that take on a discrete set of values, like the &#34;Region&#34; variable in the WHO dataset from the second lecture of Unit 1. This is an unordered factor because there isn&#39;t any natural ordering between the levels. An ordered factor has a natural ordering between the levels (an example would be the classifications &#34;large,&#34; &#34;medium,&#34; and &#34;small&#34;).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which of the following variables is an unordered factor with at least 3 levels? (Select all that apply.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; grade &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; male &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; raceeth &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which of the following variables is an ordered factor with at least 3 levels? (Select all that apply.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; grade &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; male &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_720ae56cf20e457e80c6628837c24a35_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 2.2 - Unordered factors in regression models &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;To include unordered factors in a linear regression model, we define one level as the &#34;reference level&#34; and add a binary variable for each of the remaining levels. In this way, a factor with n levels is replaced by n-1 binary variables. The reference level is typically selected to be the most frequently occurring level in the dataset.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;As an example, consider the unordered factor variable &#34;color&#34;, with levels &#34;red&#34;, &#34;green&#34;, and &#34;blue&#34;. If &#34;green&#34; were the reference level, then we would add binary variables &#34;colorred&#34; and &#34;colorblue&#34; to a linear regression problem. All red examples would have colorred=1 and colorblue=0. All blue examples would have colorred=0 and colorblue=1. All green examples would have colorred=0 and colorblue=0.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Now, consider the variable &#34;raceeth&#34; in our problem, which has levels &#34;American Indian/Alaska Native&#34;, &#34;Asian&#34;, &#34;Black&#34;, &#34;Hispanic&#34;, &#34;More than one race&#34;, &#34;Native Hawaiian/Other Pacific Islander&#34;, and &#34;White&#34;. Because it is the most common in our population, we will select White as the reference level.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which binary variables will be included in the regression model? (Select all that apply.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; raceethAmerican Indian/Alaska Native &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; raceethAsian &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; raceethBlack &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; raceethHispanic &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1-choice_4-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1[]&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_06c8d28c5845428abc84b0f07d161fe6_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 2.3 - Example unordered factors &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Consider again adding our unordered factor race to the regression model with reference level &#34;White&#34;.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;For a student who is Asian, which binary variables would be set to 0? All remaining variables will be set to 1. (Select all that apply.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; raceethAmerican Indian/Alaska Native &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; raceethAsian &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; raceethBlack &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; raceethHispanic &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1-choice_4-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1_choice_4&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_4&#34;/&gt; raceethMore than one race &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1-choice_5-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1[]&#34; id=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1_choice_5&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-checkbox&#34; value=&#34;choice_5&#34;/&gt; raceethNative Hawaiian/Other Pacific Islander &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;For a student who is white, which binary variables would be set to 0? All remaining variables will be set to 1. (Select all that apply.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_6bca6ff20ffa4600bb393fa5936abd84_3_1[]&#34; id=&#34;f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.1 - Building a model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Because the race variable takes on text values, it was loaded as a factor variable when we read in the dataset with read.csv() -- you can see this when you run str(pisaTrain) or str(pisaTest). However, by default R selects the first level alphabetically (&#34;American Indian/Alaska Native&#34;) as the reference level of our factor instead of the most common level (&#34;White&#34;). Set the reference level of the factor by typing the following two lines in your R console:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;pisaTrain$raceeth = relevel(pisaTrain$raceeth, &#34;White&#34;)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;pisaTest$raceeth = relevel(pisaTest$raceeth, &#34;White&#34;)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Now, build a linear regression model (call it lmScore) using the training set to predict readingScore using all the remaining variables. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;It would be time-consuming to type all the variables, but R provides the shorthand notation &#34;readingScore ~ .&#34; to mean &#34;predict readingScore using all the other variables in the data frame.&#34; The period is used to replace listing out all of the independent variables. As an example, if your dependent variable is called &#34;Y&#34;, your independent variables are called &#34;X1&#34;, &#34;X2&#34;, and &#34;X3&#34;, and your training data set is called &#34;Train&#34;, instead of the regular notation:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;LinReg = lm(Y ~ X1 + X2 + X3, data = Train)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;You would use the following command to build your model:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;LinReg = lm(Y ~ ., data = Train)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the Multiple R-squared value of lmScore on the training set?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Note that this R-squared is lower than the ones for the models we saw in the lectures and recitation. This does not necessarily imply that the model is of poor quality. More often than not, it simply means that the prediction problem at hand (predicting a student&#39;s test score based on demographic and school-related variables) is more difficult than other prediction problems (like predicting a team&#39;s number of wins from their runs scored and allowed, or predicting the quality of wine from weather conditions).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.1 - Building a model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 5 attempts &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;f4c37a3e954244e2ab0eb07ae12fa5bd-problem-title&#34;&gt;Answers are displayed within the problem &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-9" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="1" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.2 - Computing the root-mean squared error of the model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the training-set root-mean squared error (RMSE) of lmScore?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_04dd6a4b96be470ba46b97d794c81d2b_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; Problem 3.3 - Comparing predictions for similar students &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@eabd1ef52ec242f583c895e715893043-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Consider two students A and B. They have all variable values the same, except that student A is in grade 11 and student B is in grade 9. What is the predicted reading score of student A minus the predicted reading score of student B?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; Problem 3.4 - Interpreting model coefficients &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the meaning of the coefficient associated with variable raceethAsian?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; Predicted average reading score of an Asian student &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; Difference between the average reading score of an Asian student and the average reading score of a white student &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; Difference between the average reading score of an Asian student and the average reading score of all the students in the dataset &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; Predicted difference in the reading score between an Asian student and a white student who is otherwise identical &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_a68c789651de4d41896b2a722af1321d_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.4 - Interpreting model coefficients&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; Problem 3.5 - Identifying variables lacking statistical significance &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c495904267eb48bd91ebef19d559842f-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Based on the significance codes, which variables are candidates for removal from the model? Select all that apply. (We&#39;ll assume that the factor variable raceeth should only be removed if none of its levels are significant.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; id=&#34;dd47a11c930c4519a580297a4305356a-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@dd47a11c930c4519a580297a4305356a-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 4.1 - Predicting on unseen data &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@dd47a11c930c4519a580297a4305356a-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Using the &#34;predict&#34; function and supplying the &#34;newdata&#34; argument, use the lmScore model to predict the reading scores of students in pisaTest. Call this vector of predictions &#34;predTest&#34;. Do not change the variables in the model (for example, do not remove variables that we found were not significant in the previous part of this problem). Use the summary function to describe the test set predictions.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the range between the maximum and minimum predicted reading score on the test set?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_dd47a11c930c4519a580297a4305356a_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_dd47a11c930c4519a580297a4305356a_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_dd47a11c930c4519a580297a4305356a_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; Problem 4.2 - Test set SSE and RMSE &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@e8b653c27afe4b39979a4f9050824c1f-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the sum of squared errors (SSE) of lmScore on the testing set?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; id=&#34;d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 4.3 - Baseline prediction and test-set SSE &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the predicted test score used in the baseline model? Remember to compute this value using the training set and not the test set.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the sum of squared errors of the baseline model on the testing set? HINT: We call the sum of squared errors for the baseline model the total sum of squares (SST).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_3_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_3_1&#34; id=&#34;input_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_3_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_3_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_3_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_3_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_3_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c_solution_2&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 4.3 - Baseline prediction and test-set SSE&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 5 attempts &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;d53c7079e970464394b8a52a2151c03c-problem-title&#34;&gt;Answers are displayed within the problem &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-16" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3bf82489f6804c1a9b9d34c0597bc4b0"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3bf82489f6804c1a9b9d34c0597bc4b0" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_3bf82489f6804c1a9b9d34c0597bc4b0" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="3bf82489f6804c1a9b9d34c0597bc4b0-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3bf82489f6804c1a9b9d34c0597bc4b0" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3bf82489f6804c1a9b9d34c0597bc4b0/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="1" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; Problem 4.4 - Test-set R-squared &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3bf82489f6804c1a9b9d34c0597bc4b0-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the test-set R-squared value of lmScore?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; if (thread.get("thread_type") == "question") { if (endorsement.username) { // Translators: time_ago is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp // like "4 hours ago" or "about a month ago" fmt = gettext("marked as answer %(time_ago)s by %(user)s"); %> <%= interpolate(fmt, {time_ago: time_ago, user: endorser_display}, true) %> <% } %> </p> <div class="post-labels"> <span class="post-label post-label-reported"> <span class="icon fa fa-flag" aria-hidden="true"></span><%- gettext("Reported") %> </span> </div> </div> <div class="response-header-actions"> <%= _.template( $('#forum-actions').html())( { contentId: cid, contentType: 'response', primaryActions: ['vote', thread.get('thread_type') == 'question' ? 'answer' : 'endorse'], secondaryActions: ['edit', 'delete', 'report'], readOnly: readOnly } ) %> </div> </header> <div class="response-body"><%- body %></div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-response-edit-template"> <div class="edit-post-form"> <h<%- startHeader %>><%- gettext("Editing response") %></h<%- startHeader %>> <ul class="edit-post-form-errors"></ul> <div class="form-row"> <div class="edit-post-body" name="body" data-id="<%- id %>"><%- body %></div> </div> <button type="submit" id="edit-response-submit"class="btn-brand post-update"><%- gettext("Update response") %></button> <button class="btn post-cancel"><%- gettext("Cancel") %></button> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="response-comment-show-template"> <div class="discussion-comment" id="comment_<%- id %>"> <div class="response-body"><%- body %></div> <%= _.template( $('#forum-actions').html())( { contentId: cid, contentType: 'comment', primaryActions: [], secondaryActions: ['edit', 'delete', 'report'], readOnly: readOnly } ) %> <p class="posted-details"> <% var time_ago = interpolate( '<span class="timeago" title="%(time)s">%(time)s</span>', {time: created_at}, true ); %> <%= interpolate( // Translators: 'timeago' is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp (see: https://github.com/rmm5t/jquery-timeago) gettext("posted %(time_ago)s by %(author)s"), {time_ago: time_ago, author: author_display}, true ) %> </p> <div class="post-labels"> <span class="post-label post-label-reported"> <span class="icon fa fa-flag" aria-hidden="true"></span><%- gettext("Reported") %> </span> </div> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="response-comment-edit-template"> <div class="edit-post-form" id="comment_<%- id %>"> <h<%- startHeader %> ><%- gettext("Editing comment") %></h<%- startHeader%>> <ul class="edit-comment-form-errors"></ul> <div class="form-row"> <div class="edit-comment-body" name="body" data-id="<%- id %>"><%- body %></div> </div> <button type="submit" id="edit-comment-submit" class="btn-brand post-update"><%- gettext("Update comment") %></button> <button class="btn post-cancel"><%- gettext("Cancel") %></button> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-list-item-template"> <li data-id="<%- id %>" class="forum-nav-thread<% if (!hideReadState && neverRead) { %> never-read<% } %>"> <a href="<%- threadUrl %>" class="forum-nav-thread-link"> <div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-0"> <% var icon_class, sr_text; if (thread_type === "discussion") { icon_class = "fa-comments"; // Translators: This is a label for a Discussion forum thread sr_text = gettext("discussion"); } else if (endorsed) { icon_class = "fa-check-square-o"; // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread with a marked answer sr_text = gettext("answered question"); } else { icon_class = "fa-question"; // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread without a marked answer sr_text = gettext("unanswered question"); } %> <span class="sr"><%= sr_text %></span> <span class="icon fa <%= icon_class %>" aria-hidden="true"></span> </div><div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-1"> <span class="forum-nav-thread-title"><%- title %></span> <% if (showThreadPreview){ %> <div class="thread-preview-body"><%- threadPreview %></div> <% } %> <% if(typeof(subscribed) === "undefined") { var subscribed = null; } %> <% if(pinned || subscribed || staff_authored || community_ta_authored) { %> <ul class="forum-nav-thread-labels"> <% if (pinned) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-pinned"> <span class="icon fa fa-thumb-tack" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that has been pinned %> <%- gettext("Pinned") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (subscribed) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-following"> <span class="icon fa fa-star" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that the user is subscribed to %> <%- gettext("Following") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (staff_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-staff"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a member of the course staff %> <%- gettext("Staff") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (community_ta_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-community-ta"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a community TA %> <%- gettext("Community TA") %> </li> <% } %> </ul> <% } %> </div><div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-2"> <% // Translators: 'votes_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_start' and 'span_end' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'votes'. var fmt = ngettext( "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s vote %(span_end)s", "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s votes %(span_end)s", votes['up_count'] ); %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-votes-count"> +<%= interpolate(fmt, { votes_count: votes['up_count'], span_start: '<span class="sr">', span_end: '</span>' }, true) %> </span> <% if (!hideReadState && !neverRead && unread_comments_count > 0) { %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-unread-comments-count"> <%- StringUtils.interpolate( gettext('{unread_comments_count} new'), {unread_comments_count: unread_comments_count} ) %> </span> <% } %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-comments-count"> <% var fmt; // Counts in data do not include the post itself, but the UI should var data = { 'span_sr_open': '<span class="sr">', 'span_close': '</span>', 'unread_comments_count': unread_comments_count + (read ? 0 : 1), 'comments_count': comments_count + 1 }; if (unread_comments_count > 0) { // Translators: 'comments_count' and 'unread_comments_count' are numerical placeholders for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments (%(unread_comments_count)s unread comments)%(span_close)s'); } else { // Translators: 'comments_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments %(span_close)s'); } print(interpolate(fmt, data, true)); %> </span> </div> </a> </li> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="search-alert-template"> <div class="search-alert <%- css_class %>" id="search-alert-<%- cid %>"> <div class="search-alert-content"> <p class="message"><%= HtmlUtils.ensureHtml(messageHtml) %></p> </div> <div class="search-alert-controls"> <button class="btn-link dismiss control control-dismiss" title="<%- gettext('Close') %>"> <span class="icon fa fa-remove" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> </div> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="new-post-template"> <form class="forum-new-post-form"> <h<%- startHeader %> class="thread-title"><%- gettext("Add a Post") %></h<%- startHeader %>> <% if (mode === 'inline') { %> <button class="btn-default add-post-cancel"> <span class="sr"><%- gettext('Cancel') %></span> <span class="fa fa-close" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> <% } %> <ul class="post-errors" style="display: none"></ul> <div class="forum-new-post-form-wrapper"></div> <% if (group_options) { %> <div class="post-field group-selector-wrapper <% if (!is_commentable_divided) { print('disabled'); <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-vertical" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="VerticalStudentView" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@cdef1d4265fe4ec0b7cb0bf7226baf51" data-block-type="vertical"> <h2 class="hd hd-2 unit-title">Detecting Flu Epidemics via Search Engine Query Data </h2> <div class="bookmark-button-wrapper"> <button class="btn btn-link bookmark-button " aria-pressed="false" data-bookmark-id="strgeon,block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@cdef1d4265fe4ec0b7cb0bf7226baf51" data-bookmarks-api-url="/api/bookmarks/v1/bookmarks/"> <span class="bookmark-text">Bookmark this page</span> </button> </div> <div class="vert-mod"> <div class="vert vert-0" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@2a4ea4133aed4afea46096fb544dcc6f"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-html xmodule_display xmodule_HtmlModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="html" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@2a4ea4133aed4afea46096fb544dcc6f" data-type="HTMLModule" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "HTMLModule"} </script> <h2 style="text-rendering: optimizelegibility; outline-width: 0px; outline-style: initial; outline-color: initial; font-size: 16px; font: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; padding: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 1.416em 0px; border: 0px initial initial;">Detecting Flu Epidemics via Search Engine Query Data&nbsp;</h2> <p style="text-rendering: optimizelegibility; outline-width: 0px; outline-style: initial; outline-color: initial; font-size: 16px; font: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; padding: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 1.416em 0px; border: 0px initial initial;">Flu epidemics constitute a major public health concern causing respiratory illnesses, hospitalizations, and deaths. According to the National Vital Statistics Reports published in October 2012, influenza ranked as the eighth leading cause of death in 2011 in the United States. Each year, 250,000 to 500,000 deaths are attributed to influenza related diseases throughout the world.</p> <p style="text-rendering: optimizelegibility; outline-width: 0px; outline-style: initial; outline-color: initial; font-size: 16px; font: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; padding: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 1.416em 0px; border: 0px initial initial;">The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the European Influenza Surveillance Scheme (EISS) detect influenza activity through virologic and clinical data, including Influenza-like Illness (ILI) physician visits. Reporting national and regional data, however, are published with a 1-2 week lag.</p> <p style="text-rendering: optimizelegibility; outline-width: 0px; outline-style: initial; outline-color: initial; font-size: 16px; font: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; padding: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 1.416em 0px; border: 0px initial initial;">The <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="https://www.google.org/flutrends/us/#US">Google Flu Trends</a></span> project was initiated to see if faster reporting can be made possible by considering flu-related online search queries -- data that is available almost immediately.</p> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-1" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="6" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 1.1 - Understanding the Data &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;We would like to estimate influenza-like illness (ILI) activity using Google web search logs. Fortunately, one can easily access this data online:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;ILI Data - The &lt;u&gt;&lt;a href=&#34;http://www.cdc.gov/flu/weekly/fluactivitysurv.htm&#34;&gt;CDC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/u&gt; publishes on its website the official regional and state-level percentage of patient visits to healthcare providers for ILI purposes on a weekly basis. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt; &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Google Search Queries - &lt;u&gt;&lt;a href=&#34;http://www.google.com/trends/&#34;&gt;Google Trends&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/u&gt; allows public retrieval of weekly counts for every query searched by users around the world. For each location, the counts are normalized by dividing the count for each query in a particular week by the total number of online search queries submitted in that location during the week. Then, the values are adjusted to be between 0 and 1. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt; &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;The csv file &lt;u&gt;&lt;a href=&#34;//d37djvu3ytnwxt.cloudfront.net/assets/courseware/v1/df331a605387ca8382972c88d2853ddf/asset-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@asset+block/FluTrain.csv&#34;&gt;FluTrain.csv&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/u&gt; aggregates this data from January 1, 2004 until December 31, 2011 as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&#34;Week&#34; - The range of dates represented by this observation, in year/month/day format. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&#34;ILI&#34; - This column lists the percentage of ILI-related physician visits for the corresponding week.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&#34;Queries&#34; - This column lists the fraction of queries that are ILI-related for the corresponding week, adjusted to be between 0 and 1 (higher values correspond to more ILI-related search queries).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt; Before applying analytics tools on the training set, we first need to understand the data at hand. Load &#34;FluTrain.csv&#34; into a data frame called FluTrain. Looking at the time period 2004-2011, which week corresponds to the highest percentage of ILI-related physician visits? Select the day of the month corresponding to the start of this week.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;table&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt;&lt;select name=&#34;input_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;option_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_2_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;January&#34;&gt; January&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;February&#34;&gt; February&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;March&#34;&gt; March&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;April&#34;&gt; April&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;May&#34;&gt; May&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;June&#34;&gt; June&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;July&#34;&gt; July&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;August&#34;&gt; August&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;September&#34;&gt; September&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;October&#34;&gt; October&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;November&#34;&gt; November&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;December&#34;&gt; December&lt;/option&gt;&lt;/select&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;option_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_3_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;1&#34;&gt; 1&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;2&#34;&gt; 2&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;3&#34;&gt; 3&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;4&#34;&gt; 4&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;5&#34;&gt; 5&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;6&#34;&gt; 11&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;12&#34;&gt; 12&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;13&#34;&gt; 13&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;14&#34;&gt; 14&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;15&#34;&gt; 15&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;16&#34;&gt; 16&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;17&#34;&gt; 17&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;18&#34;&gt; 18&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;19&#34;&gt; 27&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;28&#34;&gt; 28&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;29&#34;&gt; 29&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;30&#34;&gt; 30&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;31&#34;&gt; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 3&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt;&lt;select name=&#34;input_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_4_1&#34; id=&#34;input_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_4_1&#34; 31&lt;/option&gt;&lt;/select&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_6_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p class=&#34;answer&#34; id=&#34;answer_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_6_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 6&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;inputtype option-input &#34;&gt;&lt;select name=&#34;input_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_7_1&#34; id=&#34;input_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_7_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_7_1&#34;&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;option_b17d7557330c45a19e596b9f8151d136_7_1_dummy_default&#34;&gt;Select an option&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;2004&#34;&gt; 2004&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;2005&#34;&gt; 2005&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;2006&#34;&gt; 2006&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;2007&#34;&gt; 2007&lt;/option&gt;&lt;option value=&#34;2008&#34;&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 1.1 - Understanding the Data&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; id=&#34;06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 1.2 - Understanding the Data &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Let us now understand the data at an aggregate level. Plot the histogram of the dependent variable, ILI. What best describes the distribution of values of ILI?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; Most of the ILI values are small, with a relatively small number of much larger values (in statistics, this sort of data is called &#34;skew right&#34;). &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; The ILI values are balanced, with equal numbers of unusually large and unusually small values. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; Most of the ILI values are large, with a relatively small number of much smaller values (in statistics, this sort of data is called &#34;skew left&#34;). &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 1.2 - Understanding the Data&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 1 attempt &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;06daeba6c5c74f58a4db97a85c109172-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-3" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="1" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 1.3 - Understanding the Data &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;When handling a skewed dependent variable, it is often useful to predict the logarithm of the dependent variable instead of the dependent variable itself -- this prevents the small number of unusually large or small observations from having an undue influence on the sum of squared errors of predictive models. In this problem, we will predict the natural log of the ILI variable, which can be computed in R using the log() function.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Plot the natural logarithm of ILI versus Queries. What does the plot suggest?. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; There is a negative, linear relationship between log(ILI) and Queries. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; There is no apparent linear relationship between log(ILI) and Queries. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; There is a positive, linear relationship between log(ILI) and Queries. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 1.3 - Understanding the Data&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 1 attempt &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;6c953710d3624b3499de1ee972051173-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; Problem 2.1 - Linear Regression Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Based on the plot we just made, it seems that a linear regression model could be a good modeling choice. Based on our understanding of the data from the previous subproblem, which model best describes our estimation problem?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; ILI = intercept + coefficient x Queries, where the coefficient is negative &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; Queries = intercept + coefficient x ILI, where the coefficient is negative &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_e3757b6048d74976a85ee45db04f7e93_2_1&#34; Problem 2.2 - Linear Regression Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@71dc6ef6f49a4b32bf255713c3179e45-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Let&#39;s call the regression model from the previous problem (Problem 2.1) FluTrend1 and run it in R. Hint: to take the logarithm of a variable Var in a regression equation, you simply use log(Var) when specifying the formula to the lm() function.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the training set R-squared value for FluTrend1 model (the &#34;Multiple R-squared&#34;)?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_71dc6ef6f49a4b32bf255713c3179e45_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34;
