Problem 2.3 - Linear Regression Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;For a single variable linear regression model, there is a direct relationship between the R-squared and the correlation between the independent and the dependent variables. What is the relationship we infer from our problem? (Don&#39;t forget that you can use the cor function to compute the correlation between two variables.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; R-squared = Correlation^2 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; R-squared = log(1/Correlation) &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; R-squared = exp(-0.5*Correlation) &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Note that the &#34;exp&#34; function stands for the exponential function. The exponential can be computed in R using the function exp().&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 2.3 - Linear Regression Model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 1 attempt &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; aria-describedby=&#34;14db0e32ba044522ab797e272bc08f66-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; id=&#34;180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.1 - Performance on the Test Set &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;The csv file &lt;u&gt;&lt;a href=&#34;//d37djvu3ytnwxt.cloudfront.net/assets/courseware/v1/b09d1c001a63a540e853c5250f43d6a5/asset-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@asset+block/FluTest.csv&#34;&gt;FluTest.csv&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/u&gt; provides the 2012 weekly data of the ILI-related search queries and the observed weekly percentage of ILI-related physician visits. Load this data into a data frame called FluTest.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Normally, we would obtain test-set predictions from the model FluTrend1 using the code&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;PredTest1 = predict(FluTrend1, newdata=FluTest)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;However, the dependent variable in our model is log(ILI), so PredTest1 would contain predictions of the log(ILI) value. We are instead interested in obtaining predictions of the ILI value. We can convert from predictions of log(ILI) to predictions of ILI via exponentiation, or the exp() function. The new code, which predicts the ILI value, is&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;PredTest1 = exp(predict(FluTrend1, newdata=FluTest))&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is our estimate for the percentage of ILI-related physician visits for the week of March 11, 2012? (HINT: You can either just output FluTest$Week to find which element corresponds to March 11, 2012, or you can use the &#34;which&#34; function in R. To learn more about the which function, type ?which in your R console.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.1 - Performance on the Test Set&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;180b19ebffd74e1cad0acbbd72d9edb5-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-8" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="1" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.2 - Performance on the Test Set &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the relative error betweeen the estimate (our prediction) and the observed value for the week of March 11, 2012? Note that the relative error is calculated as &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;(Observed ILI - Estimated ILI)/Observed ILI&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.2 - Performance on the Test Set&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_3efeff0d4815439685736c1c7f593bef&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 3 attempts &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; Problem 3.3 - Performance on the Test Set &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@916240932bd242fe98729d1cce680555-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) between our estimates and the actual observations for the percentage of ILI-related physician visits, on the test set?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_916240932bd242fe98729d1cce680555_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_916240932bd242fe98729d1cce680555_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_916240932bd242fe98729d1cce680555_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.3 - Performance on the Test Set&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; id=&#34;27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 4.1 - Training a Time Series Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;The observations in this dataset are consecutive weekly measurements of the dependent and independent variables. This sort of dataset is called a &#34;time series.&#34; Often, statistical models can be improved by predicting the current value of the dependent variable using the value of the dependent variable from earlier weeks. In our models, this means we will predict the ILI variable in the current week using values of the ILI variable from previous weeks.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;First, we need to decide the amount of time to lag the observations. Because the ILI variable is reported with a 1- or 2-week lag, a decision maker cannot rely on the previous week&#39;s ILI value to predict the current week&#39;s value. Instead, the decision maker will only have data available from 2 or more weeks ago. We will build a variable called ILILag2 that contains the ILI value from 2 weeks before the current observation.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;To do so, we will use the &#34;zoo&#34; package, which provides a number of helpful methods for time series models. While many functions are built into R, you need to add new packages to use some functions. New packages can be installed and loaded easily in R, and we will do this many times in this class. Run the following two commands to install and load the zoo package. In the first command, you will be prompted to select a CRAN mirror to use for your download. Select a mirror near you geographically.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;install.packages(&#34;zoo&#34;)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;library(zoo)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;After installing and loading the zoo package, run the following commands to create the ILILag2 variable in the training set:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;ILILag2 = lag(zoo(FluTrain$ILI), -2, na.pad=TRUE)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;FluTrain$ILILag2 = coredata(ILILag2)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;In these commands, the value of -2 passed to lag means to return 2 observations before the current one; a positive value would have returned future observations. The parameter na.pad=TRUE means to add missing values for the first two weeks of our dataset, where we can&#39;t compute the data from 2 weeks earlier.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;How many values are missing in the new ILILag2 variable?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 4.1 - Training a Time Series Model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 3 attempts &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;27176e0978f6453fa2c4044cedc590e7-problem-title&#34;&gt;Answers are displayed within the problem &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-11" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="1" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 4.2 - Training a Time Series Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Use the plot() function to plot the log of ILILag2 against the log of ILI. Which best describes the relationship between these two variables?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; There is a strong negative relationship between log(ILILag2) and log(ILI). &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; This is a weak or no relationship between log(ILILag2) and log(ILI) &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; There is a strong positive relationship between log(ILILag2) and log(ILI). &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_16b90789d59a4f59888b69db15698d2c_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; Problem 4.3 - Training a Time Series Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c893d95048a6420d8dc4caab6b5714f3-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Train a linear regression model on the FluTrain dataset to predict the log of the ILI variable using the Queries variable as well as the log of the ILILag2 variable. Call this model FluTrend2.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which coefficients are significant at the p=0.05 level in this regression model? (Select all that apply.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_c893d95048a6420d8dc4caab6b5714f3_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;checkbox&#34; name=&#34;input_c893d95048a6420d8dc4caab6b5714f3_2_1[]&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_c893d95048a6420d8dc4caab6b5714f3_3_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; id=&#34;1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 4.4 - Training a Time Series Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;On the basis of R-squared value and significance of coefficients, which statement is the most accurate?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; Due to overfitting, FluTrend2 is a weaker model then FluTrend1 on the training set. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; FluTrend2 is about the same quality as FluTrend1 on the training set. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; FluTrend2 is a stronger model than FluTrend1 on the training set. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 4.4 - Training a Time Series Model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_1d5870eb97e248c0b7356efa85fe1f1c&#34; These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; Problem 5.1 - Evaluating the Time Series Model in the Test Set &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@0f10522832fd45e2af225bc9903a18e7-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;So far, we have only added the ILILag2 variable to the FluTrain data frame. To make predictions with our FluTrend2 model, we will also need to add ILILag2 to the FluTest data frame (note that adding variables before splitting into a training and testing set can prevent this duplication of effort).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Modify the code from the previous subproblem to add an ILILag2 variable to the FluTest data frame. How many missing values are there in this new variable?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_0f10522832fd45e2af225bc9903a18e7_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_0f10522832fd45e2af225bc9903a18e7_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_0f10522832fd45e2af225bc9903a18e7_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_0f10522832fd45e2af225bc9903a18e7_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_0f10522832fd45e2af225bc9903a18e7_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_0f10522832fd45e2af225bc9903a18e7_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_0f10522832fd45e2af225bc9903a18e7_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_0f10522832fd45e2af225bc9903a18e7_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 5.1 - Evaluating the Time Series Model in the Test Set&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; id=&#34;f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 5.2 - Evaluating the Time Series Model in the Test Set &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;In this problem, the training and testing sets are split sequentially -- the training set contains all observations from 2004-2011 and the testing set contains all observations from 2012. There is no time gap between the two datasets, meaning the first observation in FluTest was recorded one week after the last observation in FluTrain. From this, we can identify how to fill in the missing values for the ILILag2 variable in FluTest.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which value should be used to fill in the ILILag2 variable for the first observation in FluTest?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; The ILI value of the second-to-last observation in the FluTrain data frame. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; The ILI value of the last observation in the FluTrain data frame. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; The ILI value of the first observation in the FluTest data frame. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; The ILI value of the second observation in the FluTest data frame. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which value should be used to fill in the ILILag2 variable for the second observation in FluTest?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_3_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f5d29d6e94f045a38adbe10e34e79a15_3_1-choice_0-label&#34; id=&#34;027048d0b1a042a3aa21b481b54780b6-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@027048d0b1a042a3aa21b481b54780b6-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 5.3 - Evaluating the Time Series Model in the Test Set &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@027048d0b1a042a3aa21b481b54780b6-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Fill in the missing values for ILILag2 in FluTest. In terms of syntax, you could set the value of ILILag2 in row &#34;x&#34; of the FluTest data frame to the value of ILI in row &#34;y&#34; of the FluTrain data frame with &#34;FluTest$ILILag2[x] = FluTrain$ILI[y]&#34;. Use the answer to the previous questions to determine the appropriate values of &#34;x&#34; and &#34;y&#34;. It may be helpful to check the total number of rows in FluTrain using str(FluTrain) or nrow(FluTrain).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_027048d0b1a042a3aa21b481b54780b6_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the new value of the ILILag2 variable in the first row of FluTest?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; Problem 5.4 - Evaluating the Time Series Model in the Test Set &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b227d135ccef4cf6bb12d4295afce009-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Obtain test set predictions of the ILI variable from the FluTrend2 model, again remembering to call the exp() function on the result of the predict() function to obtain predictions for ILI instead of log(ILI).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the test-set RMSE of the FluTrend2 model?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; id=&#34;f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 5.5 - Evaluating the Time Series Model in the Test Set &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which model obtained the best test-set RMSE?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; FluTrend1 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; FluTrend2 &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;In this problem, we used a simple time series model with a single lag term. ARIMA models are a more general form of the model we built, which can include multiple lag terms as well as more complicated combinations of previous values of the dependent variable. If you&#39;re interested in learning more, check out ?arima or the available online tutorials for these sorts of models.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 5.5 - Evaluating the Time Series Model in the Test Set&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 1 attempt &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;f308da9b04fd44c2929cc9109c71df13-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general class="timeago" title="%(created_at)s">%(created_at)s</span>', {created_at: created_at}, true ); var postedTimeAgoMessage; // Using a separate message to ensure proper translation for different languages // thread_type describes the kind of post this is (e.g. "question" or "discussion"); // time_ago is how much time has passed since the post was created (e.g. "4 hours ago") if (thread_type === 'discussion') { postedTimeAgoMessage = gettext('discussion posted %(time_ago)s by %(author)s'); } else { postedTimeAgoMessage = gettext('question posted %(time_ago)s by %(author)s'); } %> <%= // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread with a marked answer sr_text = gettext("answered question"); } else { icon_class = "fa-question"; // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread without a marked answer sr_text = gettext("unanswered question"); } %> <% if(pinned || subscribed || staff_authored || community_ta_authored) { %> <ul class="forum-nav-thread-labels"> <% if (pinned) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-pinned"> <span class="icon fa fa-thumb-tack" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that has been pinned %> <%- gettext("Pinned") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (subscribed) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-following"> <span class="icon fa fa-star" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that the user is subscribed to %> <%- gettext("Following") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (staff_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-staff"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a member of the course staff %> <%- gettext("Staff") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (community_ta_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-community-ta"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a community TA %> <%- gettext("Community TA") %> </li> <% } %> </ul> <% } %> </div><div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-2"> <% // Translators: 'votes_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_start' and 'span_end' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'votes'. var fmt = ngettext( "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s vote %(span_end)s", "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s votes %(span_end)s", votes['up_count'] ); %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-votes-count"> +<%= interpolate(fmt, { votes_count: votes['up_count'], span_start: '<span class="sr">', span_end: '</span>' }, true) %> </span> <% if (!hideReadState && !neverRead && unread_comments_count > 0) { %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-unread-comments-count"> <%- StringUtils.interpolate( gettext('{unread_comments_count} new'), {unread_comments_count: unread_comments_count} ) %> </span> <% } %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-comments-count"> <% var fmt; // Counts in data do not include the post itself, but the UI should var data = { 'span_sr_open': '<span class="sr">', 'span_close': '</span>', 'unread_comments_count': unread_comments_count + (read ? 0 : 1), 'comments_count': comments_count + 1 }; if (unread_comments_count > 0) { // Translators: 'comments_count' and 'unread_comments_count' are numerical placeholders for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments (%(unread_comments_count)s unread comments)%(span_close)s'); } else { // Translators: 'comments_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments %(span_close)s'); } print(interpolate(fmt, data, true)); %> </span> </div> </a> </li> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="search-alert-template"> <div class="search-alert <%- css_class %>" id="search-alert-<%- cid %>"> <div class="search-alert-content"> <p class="message"><%= HtmlUtils.ensureHtml(messageHtml) %></p> </div> <div class="search-alert-controls"> <button class="btn-link dismiss control control-dismiss" title="<%- gettext('Close') %>"> <span class="icon fa fa-remove" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> </div> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="new-post-template"> <form class="forum-new-post-form"> <h<%- startHeader %> class="thread-title"><%- gettext("Add a Post") %></h<%- startHeader %>> <% if (mode === 'inline') { %> <button class="btn-default add-post-cancel"> <span class="sr"><%- gettext('Cancel') %></span> <span class="fa fa-close" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> <% } %> <ul class="post-errors" style="display: none"></ul> <div class="forum-new-post-form-wrapper"></div> <% if (group_options) { %> <div class="post-field group-selector-wrapper <% if (!is_commentable_divided) { print('disabled'); <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="topic-template"> <label class="field-label"> <span class="field-label-text"> <%- gettext("Topic area") %> </span> <div class="field-help" (Required)") %> </div> <div class="field-input"> <select class="post-topic field-input" aria-describedby="field_help_topic_area" required> <%= edx.HtmlUtils.ensureHtml(topics_html) %> </select> </div> </label> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="post-user-display-template"> <% if (username) { %> <a href="<%- user_url %>" class="username"><%- username %></a> <% if (is_community_ta) { %> <span class="user-label-community-ta"><%- gettext("(Community TA)") %></span> <% } else if (is_staff) { %> <span class="user-label-staff"><%- gettext("(Staff)") %></span> <% } %> <% } else { %> <%- gettext('anonymous') %> <% } %> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="inline-discussion-template"> <section class="discussion inline-discussion" data-discussion-id="<%- discussionId %>"> <div class="add_post_btn_container <%if (read_only) {%>is-hidden<%} %>"> <button class="btn-link new-post-btn"><%- gettext("Add a Post") %></button> </div> <article class="new-post-article is-hidden"></article> <div class="inline-discussion-thread-container"> <section class="inline-threads" data-discussion-id="<%- discussionId %>"> </section> <div class="inline-thread"> <div class="forum-nav-bar"> <button class="btn-link all-posts-btn"> <span class="icon fa fa-chevron-prev" aria-hidden="true"></span> <span aria-hidden="true"><%- gettext('All type="text/template" id="pagination-template"> <nav class="discussion-paginator"> <ol> <% if (previous) { %> <li class="previous-page"><a class="discussion-pagination" href="<%= previous.url %>" <div class="discussion-post"> <header> <h3><%- title %></h3> <p class="posted-details"> <% if (user) { %> <a href="<%- user.url %>" class="username"><%- user.username %></a> <% } else { %> <%- discussion") %></a> </div> </article> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="customwmd-prompt-template"> <h4 id="editor-dialog-title"><%- title %></h4> <div role="status" data-user-create-comment="true" data-user-create-subcomment="true" data-read-only="false"> <div class="discussion-module-header"> <h3 class="hd hd-3 discussion-module-title">Discussion</h3> <div class="inline-discussion-topic"><span class="inline-discussion-topic-title">Topic:</span> Unit 2 / Unit 2, Homework: Detecting Flu Epidemics via Search Engine Query Data </div> </div> <button class="discussion-show btn" data-discussion-id="ba9a9aa586414fda8ca28f0584ce2ce2"> <span class="button-text">Show Discussion</span> </button> </div> <script type="text/javascript"> var $$course_id = "course\u002Dv1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"; function DiscussionInlineBlock(runtime, element) { 'use strict'; var el = $(element).find('.discussion-module'); new DiscussionInlineView({ el: el, readOnly: el.data('read-only') }); } </script> </div> </div> </div> </div>
<div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-vertical" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="VerticalStudentView" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@8f18405a93f245b183429f6c8ac07f64" data-block-type="vertical"> <h2 class="hd hd-2 unit-title">State Data (OPTIONAL)</h2> <div class="bookmark-button-wrapper"> <button class="btn btn-link bookmark-button " aria-pressed="false" data-bookmark-id="strgeon,block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@8f18405a93f245b183429f6c8ac07f64" data-bookmarks-api-url="/api/bookmarks/v1/bookmarks/"> <span class="bookmark-text">Bookmark this page</span> </button> </div> <div class="vert-mod"> <div class="vert vert-0" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@2156d1b330cc456299590d1a1b2d47ef"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-html xmodule_display xmodule_HtmlModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="html" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@2156d1b330cc456299590d1a1b2d47ef" data-type="HTMLModule" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "HTMLModule"} </script> <h3>IMPORTANT NOTE: This problem is optional, and will not count towards your grade. We have created this problem&nbsp;to give you extra practice with the topics covered in this unit.</h3> <h2></h2> <h2>State Data (OPTIONAL)</h2> <p>We often take data for granted. However, one of the hardest parts about analyzing a problem you're interested in can be to find good data to answer the questions you want to ask. As you're learning R, though, there are many datasets that R has built in that you can take advantage of.</p> <p>In this problem, we will be examining the "state" dataset, which has data from the 1970s on all fifty US states. For each state, the dataset includes the population, per capita income, illiteracy rate, murder rate, high school graduation rate, average number of frost days, area, latitude and longitude, division the state belongs to,&nbsp; region the state belongs to, and two-letter abbreviation.</p> <p>Load the dataset and convert it to a data frame by running the following two commands in R:</p> <p>data(state)</p> <p>statedata = cbind(data.frame(state.x77), state.abb, state.area, state.center,&nbsp; state.division, state.name, state.region)</p> <p>If you can't access the state dataset in R, here is a CSV file with the same data that you can load into R using the read.csv function: <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="//d37djvu3ytnwxt.cloudfront.net/assets/courseware/v1/8b670b06ca2b35c86d9b2d23b3bfca03/asset-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@asset+block/statedata.csv">statedata.csv</a></span></p> <p>After you have loaded the data into R, inspect the data set using the command: str(statedata)</p> <p>This dataset has 50 observations (one for each US state) and the following 15 variables:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Population</strong> - the population estimate of the state in 1975</li> <li><strong>Income</strong> - per capita income in 1974</li> <li><strong>Illiteracy</strong> - illiteracy rates in 1970, as a percent of the population</li> <li><strong>Life.Exp</strong> - the life expectancy in years of residents of the state in 1970</li> <li><strong>Murder</strong> - the murder and non-negligent manslaughter rate per 100,000 population in 1976&nbsp;</li> <li><strong>HS.Grad</strong> - percent of high-school graduates in 1970</li> <li><strong>Frost</strong> - the&nbsp;mean number of days with minimum temperature below freezing from 1931&ndash;1960 in the capital or a large city of the state</li> <li><strong>Area</strong> - the land area (in square miles) of the state</li> <li><strong>state.abb</strong> - a 2-letter abreviation for each state</li> <li><strong>state.area</strong> - the area of each state, in square miles</li> <li><strong>x</strong> - the longitude of the center of the state</li> <li><strong>y</strong> - the latitude of the center of the state</li> <li><strong>state.division</strong> - the division each state belongs to (New England, Middle Atlantic, South Atlantic, East South Central, West South Central, East North Central, West North Central, Mountain, or Pacific)</li> <li><strong>state.name</strong> - the full names of each state</li> <li><strong>state.region</strong> - the region each state belong to (Northeast, South, North Central, or West)</li> </ul> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-1" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 1.1 - Data Exploration &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;We begin by exploring the data. Plot all of the states&#39; centers with latitude on the y axis (the &#34;y&#34; variable in our dataset) and longitude on the x axis (the &#34;x&#34; variable in our dataset). The shape of the plot should look like the outline of the United States! Note that Alaska and Hawaii have had their coordinates adjusted to appear just off of the west coast.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;In the R command you used to generate this plot, which variable name did you use as the first argument?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; statedata$y &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_6f74a8e1904349c8b38903f26037e7ff_2_1&#34; Problem 1.2 - Data Exploration &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b2d7e452656c417998f96adc91433c5b-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Using the tapply command, determine which region of the US (West, North Central, South, or Northeast) has the highest average high school graduation rate of all the states in the region:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; Problem 1.3 - Data Exploration &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Now, make a boxplot of the murder rate by region (for more information about creating boxplots in R, type ?boxplot in your console).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which region has the highest median murder rate?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; Northeast &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; South &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; North Central &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; West &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_809b22e95b564420b57d74c5a2ececad_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 1.3 - Data Exploration&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; Problem 1.4 - Data Exploration &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@d8df9513dd714f08b607480525e873d7-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;You should see that there is an outlier in the Northeast region of the boxplot you just generated. Which state does this correspond to? (Hint: There are many ways to find the answer to this question, but one way is to use the subset command to only look at the Northeast data.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; Problem 2.1 - Predicting Life Expectancy - An Initial Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@a2c5712365164050b4bfb908c876b476-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;We would like to build a model to predict life expectancy by state using the state statistics we have in our dataset.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Build the model with all potential variables included (Population, Income, Illiteracy, Murder, HS.Grad, Frost, and Area). Note that you should use the variable &#34;Area&#34; in your model, NOT the variable &#34;state.area&#34;. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the coefficient for &#34;Income&#34; in your linear regression model?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_a2c5712365164050b4bfb908c876b476_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_a2c5712365164050b4bfb908c876b476_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_a2c5712365164050b4bfb908c876b476_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_a2c5712365164050b4bfb908c876b476_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_a2c5712365164050b4bfb908c876b476_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_a2c5712365164050b4bfb908c876b476_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_a2c5712365164050b4bfb908c876b476_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_a2c5712365164050b4bfb908c876b476_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt; id=&#34;2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 2.2 - Predicting Life Expectancy - An Initial Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Call the coefficient for income x (the answer to Problem 2.1). What is the interpretation of the coefficient x?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; For a one unit increase in income, predicted life expectancy increases by |x| &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;2180716bc04b42868fcd6209e135026d_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; Problem 2.3 - Predicting Life Expectancy - An Initial Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@683b3b0ab7ac4110bbb57ef69f84f178-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Now plot a graph of life expectancy vs. income using the command:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;plot(statedata$Income, statedata$Life.Exp)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Visually observe the plot. What appears to be the relationship?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_683b3b0ab7ac4110bbb57ef69f84f178_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_683b3b0ab7ac4110bbb57ef69f84f178_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_683b3b0ab7ac4110bbb57ef69f84f178_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; Life expectancy is somewhat positively correlated with income. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;683b3b0ab7ac4110bbb57ef69f84f178_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_683b3b0ab7ac4110bbb57ef69f84f178_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_683b3b0ab7ac4110bbb57ef69f84f178_2_1&#34; Problem 2.4 - Predicting Life Expectancy - An Initial Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;The model we built does not display the relationship we saw from the plot of life expectancy vs. income. Which of the following explanations seems the most reasonable? &lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; Income is not related to life expectancy. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; Multicollinearity &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 2.4 - Predicting Life Expectancy - An Initial Model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34;
