&lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;8c24dd36fcd7435390105d794a21c7b6-problem-title&#34;&gt;Answers are displayed within the problem &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-9" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.1 - Predicting Life Expectancy - Refining the Model and Analyzing Predictions &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Recall that we discussed the principle of simplicity: that is, a model with fewer variables is preferable to a model with many unnnecessary variables. Experiment with removing independent variables from the original model. Remember to use the significance of the coefficients to decide which variables to remove (remove the one with the largest &#34;p-value&#34; first, or the one with the &#34;t value&#34; closest to zero), and to remove them one at a time (this is called &#34;backwards variable selection&#34;). This is important due to multicollinearity issues - removing one insignificant variable may make another previously insignificant variable become significant. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;You should be able to find a good model with only 4 independent variables, instead of the original 7. Which variables does this model contain?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; Income, HS.Grad, Frost, Murder &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; HS.Grad, Population, Income, Frost &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; Frost, Murder, HS.Grad, Illiteracy &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; Population, Murder, Frost, HS.Grad &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_c3c2c089da5247acaedca13c55b02050_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.1 - Predicting Life Expectancy - Refining the Model and Analyzing Predictions&#34; /&gt; Problem 3.2 - Predicting Life Expectancy - Refining the Model and Analyzing Predictions &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Removing insignificant variables changes the Multiple R-squared value of the model. By looking at the summary output for both the initial model (all independent variables) and the simplified model (only 4 independent variables) and using what you learned in class, which of the following correctly explains the change in the Multiple R-squared value?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; We expect the &#34;Multiple R-squared&#34; value of the simplified model to be slightly worse than that of the initial model. It can&#39;t be better than the &#34;Multiple R-squared&#34; value of the initial model. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; We expect the &#34;Multiple R-squared&#34; value of the simplified model to be slightly better than that of the initial model. It can&#39;t be worse than the &#34;Multiple R-squared&#34; value of the initial model. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; We expect the &#34;Multiple R-squared&#34; of the simplified model to be about the same as the intial model (we have no way of knowing if it will be slightly worse or slightly better than the Multiple R-squared of the intial model). &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_b9a4c0bab3904dd695cc91108f9af5ff_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.2 - Predicting Life Expectancy - Refining the Model and Analyzing Predictions&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; id=&#34;4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.3 - Predicting Life Expectancy - Refining the Model and Analyzing Predictions &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Using the simplified 4 variable model that we created, we&#39;ll now take a look at how our predictions compare to the actual values. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Take a look at the vector of predictions by using the predict function (since we are just looking at predictions on the training set, you don&#39;t need to pass a &#34;newdata&#34; argument to the predict function). &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which state do we predict to have the lowest life expectancy? (Hint: use the sort function)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; South Carolina &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; Mississippi &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; Georgia &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_4d17f111c6d0481fbf115bd984ca6e45_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which state actually has the lowest life expectancy? (Hint: use the which.min function)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; Problem 3.5 - Predicting Life Expectancy - Refining the Model and Analyzing Predictions &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@09e29feea45c4eb3bd4d83dacaa35870-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Take a look at the vector of residuals (the difference between the predicted and actual values). &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;For which state do we make the smallest absolute error?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; id="field_help_title"> <%- gettext("Add a clear and descriptive title to encourage participation. print(interpolate(fmts, {num_comments: comments.length}, true)); %> <span class="icon fa fa-caret-down" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> <ol class="comments"> <li class="new-comment"> <% if (create_sub_comment && !readOnly) { %> <form class="comment-form" data-id="<%- wmdId %>"> <ul class="discussion-errors"></ul> <label class="sr" for="add-new-comment-<%- wmdId %>"><%- gettext("Add a comment") %></label> <div class="comment-body" id="add-new-comment-<%- wmdId %>" data-id="<%- wmdId %>" data-placeholder="<%- gettext('Add a comment') %>"></div> <div class="comment-post-control"> <button class="btn-brand discussion-submit-comment control-button"><%- gettext("Submit") %></button> </div> </form> <% } %> </li> </ol> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-response-show-template"> <header class="response-header"> <div class="response-header-content"> <%= author_display %> <p class="posted-details"> <span class="timeago" title="<%= created_at %>"><%= created_at %></span> <% if (obj.endorsement && obj.endorsed) { %> - <% var fmt = null; if (thread.get("thread_type") == "question") { if (endorsement.username) { // Translators: time_ago is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp // like "4 hours ago" or "about a month ago" fmt = gettext("marked as answer %(time_ago)s by %(user)s"); } else { // Translators: time_ago is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp // like "4 hours ago" or "about a month ago" fmt = gettext("marked as answer %(time_ago)s"); } } else { if (endorsement.username) { // Translators: time_ago is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp // like "4 hours ago" or "about a month ago" fmt = gettext("endorsed %(time_ago)s by %(user)s"); } else { // Translators: time_ago is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp // like "4 hours ago" or "about a month ago" fmt = gettext("endorsed %(time_ago)s"); } } var time_ago = interpolate( '<span class="timeago" title="%(time)s">%(time)s</span>', {time: endorsement.time}, true ); %> <%= interpolate(fmt, {time_ago: time_ago, user: endorser_display}, true) %> <% } %> </p> <div class="post-labels"> <span class="post-label post-label-reported"> <span class="icon fa fa-flag" aria-hidden="true"></span><%- gettext("Reported") %> </span> </div> </div> <div class="response-header-actions"> <%= _.template( $('#forum-actions').html())( { contentId: cid, contentType: 'response', primaryActions: ['vote', thread.get('thread_type') == 'question' ? 'answer' : 'endorse'], secondaryActions: ['edit', 'delete', 'report'], readOnly: readOnly } ) %> </div> </header> <div class="response-body"><%- body %></div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-response-edit-template"> <div class="edit-post-form"> <h<%- startHeader %>><%- gettext("Editing response") %></h<%- startHeader %>> <ul class="edit-post-form-errors"></ul> <div class="form-row"> <div class="edit-post-body" name="body" data-id="<%- id %>"><%- body %></div> </div> <button type="submit" id="edit-response-submit"class="btn-brand post-update"><%- gettext("Update response") %></button> <button class="btn post-cancel"><%- gettext("Cancel") %></button> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="response-comment-show-template"> <div class="discussion-comment" id="comment_<%- id %>"> <div class="response-body"><%- body %></div> <%= _.template( $('#forum-actions').html())( { contentId: cid, contentType: 'comment', primaryActions: [], secondaryActions: ['edit', 'delete', 'report'], readOnly: readOnly } ) %> <p class="posted-details"> <% var time_ago = interpolate( '<span class="timeago" title="%(time)s">%(time)s</span>', {time: created_at}, true ); %> <%= interpolate( // Translators: 'timeago' is a placeholder for a fuzzy, relative timestamp (see: https://github.com/rmm5t/jquery-timeago) gettext("posted %(time_ago)s by %(author)s"), {time_ago: time_ago, author: author_display}, true ) %> </p> <div class="post-labels"> <span class="post-label post-label-reported"> <span class="icon fa fa-flag" aria-hidden="true"></span><%- gettext("Reported") %> </span> </div> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="response-comment-edit-template"> <div class="edit-post-form" id="comment_<%- id %>"> <h<%- startHeader %> ><%- gettext("Editing comment") %></h<%- startHeader%>> <ul class="edit-comment-form-errors"></ul> <div class="form-row"> <div class="edit-comment-body" name="body" data-id="<%- id %>"><%- body %></div> </div> <button type="submit" id="edit-comment-submit" class="btn-brand post-update"><%- gettext("Update comment") %></button> <button class="btn post-cancel"><%- gettext("Cancel") %></button> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="thread-list-item-template"> <li data-id="<%- id %>" class="forum-nav-thread<% if (!hideReadState && neverRead) { %> never-read<% } %>"> <a href="<%- threadUrl %>" class="forum-nav-thread-link"> <div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-0"> <% var icon_class, sr_text; if (thread_type === "discussion") { icon_class = "fa-comments"; // Translators: This is a label for a Discussion forum thread sr_text = gettext("discussion"); } else if (endorsed) { icon_class = "fa-check-square-o"; // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread with a marked answer sr_text = gettext("answered question"); } else { icon_class = "fa-question"; // Translators: This is a label for a Question forum thread without a marked answer sr_text = gettext("unanswered question"); } %> <span class="sr"><%= sr_text %></span> <span class="icon fa <%= icon_class %>" aria-hidden="true"></span> </div><div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-1"> <span class="forum-nav-thread-title"><%- title %></span> <% if (showThreadPreview){ %> <div class="thread-preview-body"><%- threadPreview %></div> <% } %> <% if(typeof(subscribed) === "undefined") { var subscribed = null; } %> <% if(pinned || subscribed || staff_authored || community_ta_authored) { %> <ul class="forum-nav-thread-labels"> <% if (pinned) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-pinned"> <span class="icon fa fa-thumb-tack" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that has been pinned %> <%- gettext("Pinned") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (subscribed) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-following"> <span class="icon fa fa-star" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that the user is subscribed to %> <%- gettext("Following") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (staff_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-staff"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a member of the course staff %> <%- gettext("Staff") %> </li> <% } %> <% if (community_ta_authored) { %> <li class="post-label post-label-by-community-ta"> <span class="icon fa fa-user" aria-hidden="true"></span> <% // Translators: This is a label for a forum thread that was authored by a community TA %> <%- gettext("Community TA") %> </li> <% } %> </ul> <% } %> </div><div class="forum-nav-thread-wrapper-2"> <% // Translators: 'votes_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_start' and 'span_end' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'votes'. var fmt = ngettext( "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s vote %(span_end)s", "%(votes_count)s%(span_start)s votes %(span_end)s", votes['up_count'] ); %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-votes-count"> +<%= interpolate(fmt, { votes_count: votes['up_count'], span_start: '<span class="sr">', span_end: '</span>' }, true) %> </span> <% if (!hideReadState && !neverRead && unread_comments_count > 0) { %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-unread-comments-count"> <%- StringUtils.interpolate( gettext('{unread_comments_count} new'), {unread_comments_count: unread_comments_count} ) %> </span> <% } %> <span class="forum-nav-thread-comments-count"> <% var fmt; // Counts in data do not include the post itself, but the UI should var data = { 'span_sr_open': '<span class="sr">', 'span_close': '</span>', 'unread_comments_count': unread_comments_count + (read ? 0 : 1), 'comments_count': comments_count + 1 }; if (unread_comments_count > 0) { // Translators: 'comments_count' and 'unread_comments_count' are numerical placeholders for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments (%(unread_comments_count)s unread comments)%(span_close)s'); } else { // Translators: 'comments_count' is a numerical placeholder for a specific discussion thread; 'span_*' placeholders refer to HTML markup. Please translate the word 'comments'. fmt = gettext('%(comments_count)s %(span_sr_open)scomments %(span_close)s'); } print(interpolate(fmt, data, true)); %> </span> </div> </a> </li> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="search-alert-template"> <div class="search-alert <%- css_class %>" id="search-alert-<%- cid %>"> <div class="search-alert-content"> <p class="message"><%= HtmlUtils.ensureHtml(messageHtml) %></p> </div> <div class="search-alert-controls"> <button class="btn-link dismiss control control-dismiss" title="<%- gettext('Close') %>"> <span class="icon fa fa-remove" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> </div> </div> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="new-post-template"> <form class="forum-new-post-form"> <h<%- startHeader %> class="thread-title"><%- gettext("Add a Post") %></h<%- startHeader %>> <% if (mode === 'inline') { %> <button class="btn-default add-post-cancel"> <span class="sr"><%- gettext('Cancel') %></span> <span class="fa fa-close" aria-hidden="true"></span> </button> <% } %> <ul class="post-errors" style="display: none"></ul> <div class="forum-new-post-form-wrapper"></div> <% if (group_options) { %> <div class="post-field group-selector-wrapper <% if (!is_commentable_divided) { print('disabled'); aria-hidden="true"></span> </span> </button> </li> </script> <script aria-hidden="true" type="text/template" id="forum-action-pin"> <li class="actions-item"> <button class="btn-link action-list-item data-user-create-comment="true" data-user-create-subcomment="true" data-read-only="false"> <div class="discussion-module-header"> <h3 class="hd hd-3 discussion-module-title">Discussion</h3> <div class="inline-discussion-topic"><span class="inline-discussion-topic-title">Topic:</span> Unit 2 / Unit 2, Homework: State Data </div> </div> <button class="discussion-show btn" data-discussion-id="ec5029087b924087be55b270b54e2bb5"> <span class="button-text">Show Discussion</span> </button> </div> <script type="text/javascript"> var $$course_id = "course\u002Dv1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"; function DiscussionInlineBlock(runtime, element) { 'use strict'; var el = $(element).find('.discussion-module'); new DiscussionInlineView({ el: el, readOnly: <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-vertical" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="VerticalStudentView" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@4ec96b29646a4daface5242265b89a69" data-block-type="vertical"> <h2 class="hd hd-2 unit-title">Forecasting Elantra Sales (OPTIONAL)</h2> <div class="bookmark-button-wrapper"> <button class="btn btn-link bookmark-button " aria-pressed="false" data-bookmark-id="strgeon,block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@vertical+block@4ec96b29646a4daface5242265b89a69" data-bookmarks-api-url="/api/bookmarks/v1/bookmarks/"> <span class="bookmark-text">Bookmark this page</span> </button> </div> <div class="vert-mod"> <div class="vert vert-0" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@a98949de40ef4afaba68b92a87a81b78"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-html xmodule_display xmodule_HtmlModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="html" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@html+block@a98949de40ef4afaba68b92a87a81b78" data-type="HTMLModule" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "HTMLModule"} </script> <h3>IMPORTANT NOTE: This problem is optional, and will not count towards your grade. We have created this problem&nbsp;to give you extra practice with the topics covered in this unit.</h3> <h2></h2> <h2>Forecasting Elantra Sales (OPTIONAL)</h2> <p>An important application of linear regression&nbsp;is understanding sales. Consider a company that produces and sells a product. In a given period, if the company produces more units than how many consumers will buy, the company will not earn money on the unsold units and will incur additional costs due to having to store those units in inventory before they can be sold. If it produces fewer units than how many consumers will buy, the company will earn less than it potentially could have earned. Being able to predict consumer sales, therefore, is of first order importance to the company.</p> <p>In this problem, we will try to predict monthly sales of the Hyundai Elantra in the United States. The Hyundai Motor Company is a major automobile manufacturer based in South Korea. The Elantra is a car model that has been produced by Hyundai since 1990 and is sold all over the world, including the United States. We will build a linear regression&nbsp;model to predict monthly sales using economic indicators of the United States as well as Google search queries.</p> <p>The file <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="//d37djvu3ytnwxt.cloudfront.net/assets/courseware/v1/78f6bc572ffdf2bca928179d83723fb0/asset-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@asset+block/elantra.csv">elantra.csv</a></span> contains data for the problem. Each observation is a month, from January 2010 to February 2014. For each month, we have the following variables:</p> <p></p> <ul> <li><strong>Month </strong>=&nbsp;the month of the year for the observation (1 = January, 2 = February, 3 = March, ...).</li> <li><strong>Year&nbsp;</strong>=&nbsp;the year of the observation.</li> <li><strong>ElantraSales</strong>&nbsp;= the number of units of the Hyundai Elantra sold in the United States in the given month.</li> <li><strong>Unemployment</strong>&nbsp;= the estimated unemployment percentage in the United States in the given month.</li> <li><strong>Queries</strong>&nbsp;= a (normalized) approximation of the number of Google searches for "hyundai elantra" in the given month.</li> <li><strong>CPI_energy</strong>&nbsp;= the monthly consumer price index (CPI) for energy for the given month.</li> <li><strong>CPI_all&nbsp;</strong>= the consumer price index (CPI) for all products for the given month; this is a measure of the magnitude of the prices paid by consumer households for goods and services (e.g., food, clothing, electricity, etc.).</li> </ul> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-1" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 1 - Loading the Data &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Load the data set. Split the data set into training and testing sets as follows: place all observations for 2012 and earlier in the training set, and all observations for 2013 and 2014 into the testing set.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;How many observations are in the training set?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;078c75f58909493dae45c46f0cf3e198-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-2" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 2.1 - A Linear Regression Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Build a linear regression model to predict monthly Elantra sales using Unemployment, CPI_all, CPI_energy and Queries as the independent variables. Use all of the training set data to do this.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the model R-squared? Note: In this problem, we will always be asking for the &#34;Multiple R-Squared&#34; of the model.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 2.1 - A Linear Regression Model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 5 attempts &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;b41f3d8034b54090972fdbb941611a94-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; Problem 2.2 - Significant Variables &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f4e437f5755644a7a70a563df8867fb6-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt; How many variables are significant, or have levels that are significant? Use 0.10 as your p-value cutoff. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; Problem 2.4 - Interpreting the Coefficient &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the interpretation of this coefficient?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; For an increase of 1 in predicted Elantra sales, Unemployment decreases by approximately 3000. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; For an increase of 1 in Unemployment, the prediction of Elantra sales decreases by approximately 3000. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; If Unemployment increases by 1, then Elantra sales will decrease by approximately 3000; Hyundai should keep unemployment down (by creating jobs in the US or lobbying the US government) if it wishes to increase its sales. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; For an increase of 1 in Unemployment, then predicted Elantra sales will essentially stay the same, since the coefficient is not statistically significant. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 2.4 - Interpreting the Coefficient&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 1 attempt &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;968c7ffc2f9f4a8d9ca661b52458e37a-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-6" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.1 - Modeling Seasonality &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Our model R-Squared is relatively low, so we would now like to improve our model. In modeling demand and sales, it is often useful to model seasonality. Seasonality refers to the fact that demand is often cyclical/periodic in time. For example, in countries with different seasons, demand for warm outerwear (like jackets and coats) is higher in fall/autumn and winter (due to the colder weather) than in spring and summer. (In contrast, demand for swimsuits and sunscreen is higher in the summer than in the other seasons.) Another example is the &#34;back to school&#34; period in North America: demand for stationary (pencils, notebooks and so on) in late July and all of August is higher than the rest of the year due to the start of the school year in September.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;In our problem, since our data includes the month of the year in which the units were sold, it is feasible for us to incorporate monthly seasonality. From a modeling point of view, it may be reasonable that the month plays an effect in how many Elantra units are sold. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;To incorporate the seasonal effect due to the month, build a new linear regression model that predicts monthly Elantra sales using Month as well as Unemployment, CPI_all, CPI_energy and Queries. Do not modify the training and testing data frames before building the model.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the model R-Squared?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.1 - Modeling Seasonality&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 3 attempts &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;edf29df1717c4138bbea20308edc1694-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-7" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.2 - Effect of Adding a New Variable &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which of the following best describes the effect of adding Month?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; The model is better because the R-squared has increased. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; The model is not better because the adjusted R-squared has gone down and none of the variables (including the new one) are very significant. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; The model is better because the p-values of the four previous variables have decreased (they have become more significant). &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1-choice_3-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1_choice_3&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_3&#34;/&gt; The model is not better because it has more variables. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.2 - Effect of Adding a New Variable&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 1 attempt &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;f997b093bae54fb29076012f9d7c0874-problem-title&#34;&gt;Answers are displayed within the problem &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-8" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.3 - Understanding the Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Let us try to understand our model. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;In the new model, given two monthly periods that are otherwise identical in Unemployment, CPI_all, CPI_energy and Queries, what is the absolute difference in predicted Elantra sales given that one period is in January and one is in March?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_2_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;In the new model, given two monthly periods that are otherwise identical in Unemployment, CPI_all, CPI_energy and Queries, what is the absolute difference in predicted Elantra sales given that one period is in January and one is in May?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 2&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_3_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_3_1&#34; id=&#34;input_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_3_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_3_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_3_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_3_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p id=&#34;answer_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_3_1&#34; class=&#34;answer&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_e7acdbf3dd7c45d7b6d38486780b16f8_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.3 - Understanding the Model&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; id=&#34;aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 3.4 - Numeric vs. Factors &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;You may be experiencing an uneasy feeling that there is something not quite right in how we have modeled the effect of the calendar month on the monthly sales of Elantras. If so, you are right. In particular, we added Month as a variable, but Month is an ordinary numeric variable. In fact, we must convert Month to a factor variable before adding it to the model.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the best explanation for why we must do this?&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34; id=&#34;inputtype_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;fieldset aria-describedby=&#34;status_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1-choice_0-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1_choice_0&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_0&#34;/&gt; By converting Month to a factor variable, we will effectively increase the number of coefficients we need to estimate, which will boost our model&#39;s R-Squared. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1-choice_1-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1_choice_1&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_1&#34;/&gt; By modeling Month as a factor variable, the effect of each calendar month is not restricted to be linear in the numerical coding of the month. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;field&#34;&gt;&lt;label id=&#34;aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1-choice_2-label&#34; class=&#34;response-label field-label label-inline&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;radio&#34; name=&#34;input_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1_choice_2&#34; class=&#34;field-input input-radio&#34; value=&#34;choice_2&#34;/&gt; Within the data frame, Month is stored in R&#39;s Date format, causing errors in how the coefficient is estimated. &lt;/label&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;answer_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/fieldset&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;indicator-container&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;solution-span&#34;&gt;&lt;span id=&#34;solution_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4_solution_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;action&#34;&gt; &lt;input type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;problem_id&#34; value=&#34;Problem 3.4 - Numeric vs. Factors&#34; /&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submit-attempt-container&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;submit btn-brand&#34; data-submitting=&#34;Submitting&#34; data-value=&#34;Submit&#34; data-should-enable-submit-button=&#34;True&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;submission_feedback_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4&#34; &gt; &lt;span class=&#34;submit-label&#34;&gt;Submit&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;submission-feedback&#34; id=&#34;submission_feedback_aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4&#34;&gt; You have used 0 of 1 attempt &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Some problems have options such as save, reset, hints, or show answer. These options follow the Submit button.&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-action-buttons-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;problem-action-button-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;save problem-action-btn btn-default btn-small&#34; data-value=&#34;Save&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-floppy-o&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;Save&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;Save your answer&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/button&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-gentle-alert is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-exclamation-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4-problem-title&#34;&gt; &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification warning notification-save is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-save&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4-problem-title&#34;&gt;None &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification general notification-show-answer is-hidden&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;icon fa fa-info-circle&#34; aria-hidden=&#34;true&#34;&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&#34;notification-message&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;aedf1fd2c528421495c22f4b24cd30e4-problem-title&#34;&gt;Answers are displayed within the problem &lt;/span&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;notification-btn-wrapper&#34;&gt; &lt;button type=&#34;button&#34; class=&#34;btn btn-default btn-small notification-btn review-btn sr&#34;&gt;Review&lt;/button&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; " data-graded="True"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="vert vert-10" data-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642"> <div class="xblock xblock-student_view xblock-student_view-problem xmodule_display xmodule_CapaModule" data-runtime-class="LmsRuntime" data-init="XBlockToXModuleShim" data-block-type="problem" data-request-token="fc5dc282595011e79980125bdda5255c" data-runtime-version="1" data-usage-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642" data-type="Problem" data-course-id="course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017"> <script type="json/xblock-args" class="xblock-json-init-args"> {"xmodule-type": "Problem"} </script> <div id="problem_1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642" class="problems-wrapper" role="group" aria-labelledby="1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642-problem-title" data-problem-id="block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642" data-url="/courses/course-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017/xblock/block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642/handler/xmodule_handler" data-problem-score="0" data-problem-total-possible="0" data-attempts-used="0" data-content=" &lt;h3 class=&#34;hd hd-3 problem-header&#34; id=&#34;1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642-problem-title&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642-problem-progress&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34;&gt; Problem 4.1 - A New Model &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Re-run the regression with the Month variable modeled as a factor variable. (Create a new variable that models the Month as a factor (using the as.factor function) instead of overwriting the current Month variable. We&#39;ll still use the numeric version of Month later in the problem.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;What is the model R-Squared? &lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div id=&#34;inputtype_1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642_2_1&#34; class=&#34; capa_inputtype textline&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;unanswered &#34;&gt;&lt;input type=&#34;text&#34; name=&#34;input_1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642_2_1&#34; id=&#34;input_1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642_2_1&#34; aria-describedby=&#34;status_1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642_2_1&#34; value=&#34;&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;trailing_text&#34; id=&#34;trailing_text_1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642_2_1&#34;/&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status unanswered&#34; id=&#34;status_1effed3522d243b5a62518cc24626642_2_1&#34; data-tooltip=&#34;Not yet answered.&#34;&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;sr&#34;&gt;unanswered&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#34;status-icon&#34; Problem 4.2 - Significant Variables &lt;/h3&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem-progress&#34; id=&#34;block-v1:MITx+15.071x+2T2017+type@problem+block@cc1865a5b928424d84a8d6f72da17c10-problem-progress&#34;&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div class=&#34;problem&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;p&gt;Which variables are significant, or have levels that are significant? Use 0.10 as your p-value cutoff. (Select all that apply.)&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;wrapper-problem-response&#34; tabindex=&#34;-1&#34; aria-label=&#34;Question 1&#34; role=&#34;group&#34;&gt;&lt;div class=&#34;choicegroup capa_inputtype&#34;
